patterns: What are your hours of operation?
responses: The college is open from 9.20am to 3.30pm, Monday to Saturday.

patterns: What are timings of Bio break?
responses: The lunch break is for 1hr 12.30pm to 1.30pm

patterns: Does the college have a library?
responses: Yes, the college has a library. The library is located at placement block 3rd floor. The timings are from 9am to 5pm, Monday to saturday.

Malla Reddy College of Engineering & Technology (MRCET) is a constituent College of Malla Reddy Group of Institutions (MRGI) established in 2004. The College offers Engineering courses (B.Tech.) in AE, CSE, CSE(AI&ML), CSE(CS), CSE(IOT), CSE(DS), AI&ML, AI&DS, ECE, EEE, IT, MECH disciplines and Post Graduate (M.Tech.) courses in ECE, CSE, MECH and AE specializations in addition to MBA programmes. The College campus with its aboriculture and horticulture is situated away from the hustle and bustle of the city, providing a serene and tranquil atmosphere, which is conducive to both teaching and learning processes.

patterns: What are the approvals of MRCET?
responses: YES MRCET is an Autonomous Institution recognized by UGC, Govt. of INDIA. It is approved by AICTE, Govt. of India, New Delhi, and permanently affiliated to JNTUH, Hyderabad. The college is accredited by NBA, New Delhi, India, and NAAC with A-GRADE, UGC, New Delhi. It is also an ISO 9001:2015 Certified Institution and approved by the Govt. of Telangana, India. Additionally, MRCET is a UGC 2f & 12(B) recognized institution, UGC New Delhi.

patterns: What are the special achievements of MRCET?
responses: MRCET has achieved several milestones: It is an Autonomous Institution recognized by UGC, Govt. of INDIA, accredited by NBA (Tier-1), AICTE, New Delhi, and NAAC-A Grade, UGC, Govt. of India. It is also ISO 9001:2015 Certified, has 2(f) & 12(B) Recognition from UGC, Govt. of India, and its NSS Unit is recognized by JNTUH, Hyderabad. MRCET has a Research Centre Status from JNTUH, Hyderabad, MoU with NRDC, Govt. of India, and an AICTE-MHRD Institution Innovation Council, Ministry of HRD, Govt. of India. The college has an Industry Institute Partnership Cell (IIPC), recognition of Scientific Industrial Research Organizations (SIROs) by Govt. of India, and is a life member of NHRD Network. MRCET is a CISCO International Certification Authorized Centre, approved to admit Foreign Students/PIOâ€™s, a Nodal Center for IIT - Bombay/Kharagpur for Technology Transfer, and a NASSCOM Nodal Center for NAC - Test Assessment. It also houses a Business Incubation Centre - MSME, Govt. of India, and a Global Education and Career Counseling Centre.

patterns: Tell me about the founder chairman
responses: Shri CH. Malla Reddy, the most humble, dynamic, and charismatic founder chairman, is a visionary who brought about a revolution in the field of education. He is the avant-garde (pioneer) in creating numerous avenues which made professional and technical education accessible to young aspirants. Under his esteemed leadership, the campus has grown by leaps and bounds to become a major learning center with 14 institutes offering almost all Engineering, Management, Computers, and Pharmacy courses. Two hospitals, namely Narayana Hrudayalaya and Malla Reddy Cardiology Hospital, are functioning in Malla Reddy Health City. His life has rekindled many lives by not only igniting their dreams but also by accomplishing them. He strongly believes that only education can bring across a positive change in society.

patterns: Who is the secretary of mrcet?
responses: Shri CH. Mahender Reddy, the Secretary of MRCET, emphasizes the importance of professional education in the rapidly advancing technological era. He believes that choosing the right college is crucial for one's career journey. At MRCET, the focus has always been on imparting quality education in various engineering disciplines. Over the past seven years, significant efforts have been made to establish MRCET as one of the best engineering institutes in the country. The faculty members are carefully selected and continuously updated on recent technical innovations. The atmosphere at MRCET is friendly, cordial, and perfectly suited to the all-round development of students.

Dr. Ch. Bhadra Reddy, the Treasurer of MRGI, is a highly qualified professional with an M.D. degree in medicine. His youthful presence and proactive approach contribute to shaping the destiny of the student community by imparting quality education in a conducive environment, thereby motivating the students to successfully meet the contemporaneous needs of the industry.

Dr. V.S.K. Reddy, the Advisor of Malla Reddy College of Engineering & Technology, has more than 19 years of experience in teaching and industry. An alumnus of IIT Kharagpur, he obtained a Ph.D. in the area of Multi-media Signal Processing and Communication Protocols. He specializes in Electronics & Communications and Computer Science Engineering. Dr. Reddy has over 45 publications in national and international conferences and journals. He is a fellow of IETE, a life member of ISTE, and a member of IEEE. He was awarded 'Best Teacher' for three consecutive academic years with citation and cash award and received the 'India Jewel Award' for outstanding contributions in engineering and technology research.

patterns: Who is the principal? of mrcet
responses: Dr. S Srinivasa Rao, the Principal of MRCET, completed his B.Tech in Electronics & Communication Engineering from Madras Institute of Technology, Chennai. He did his M.Tech in Digital Systems & Computer Electronics from JNTU College of Engineering, Hyderabad, and his Ph.D. from JNTU University, Hyderabad, in Wireless Communications. With 25 years of teaching experience in various reputed engineering colleges in AP & Telangana, Dr. Rao has published more than 20 research papers in international journals and presented 30 research papers in international/national conferences/seminars/symposiums. He has also conducted various workshops, seminars, conferences, and FDPs.

patterns: who is the dean of mrcet
Who is the dean of student welfare?
Tell me about the dean of student welfare
Dean of student welfare at MRCET
responses: Dr. Tipirneni Venugopal, the Dean of Students Welfare, received his Bachelor of Engineering degree in Electronics Engineering from Marathwada University and a Master of Technology in Digital Systems and Computer Electronics from JNTUH. He obtained his Ph.D. in Digital Image Processing and is a member of the Institution of Engineers, ISTE, and IETE. With more than 30 years of experience in teaching, administration, and research, Dr. Venugopal has published five research papers in national and international journals and conferences. He has organized national conferences, faculty development programs, seminars, guest lectures, and attended around ten FDPs and workshops. He established a Training Technology Display and Dissemination Center for the display, demonstration, and training of DAE technologies, which is the only one in Telangana state out of ten in India, sponsored by Bhabha Atomic Research Center (BARC) Mumbai, with a sanctioned amount of 37.5 lakhs.

patterns: Tell me about the principal's profile
Who is the principal of MRCET?
Can you provide details about Dr. S Srinivasa Rao?
Who is Dr. S Srinivasa Rao?
responses: Dr. S Srinivasa Rao is the Principal of Malla Reddy College of Engineering & Technology. He has 25 years of teaching experience in various reputed engineering colleges in Andhra Pradesh & Telangana. He has published more than 20 research papers in international journals and presented 30 research papers in international/national conferences, seminars, and symposiums. He has also conducted various workshops, seminars, conferences, and faculty development programs (FDPs).

Dr. S Srinivasa Rao has a distinguished career with 25 years of teaching experience in reputed engineering colleges in AP & Telangana. He has published over 20 research papers in international journals and presented 30 research papers at international/national conferences, seminars, and symposiums.

Dr. S Srinivasa Rao's extensive experience in academia includes conducting numerous workshops, seminars, conferences, and faculty development programs (FDPs). He has also published over 20 research papers in international journals and presented 30 research papers in various academic forums.
With 25 years of teaching experience and numerous academic contributions, Dr. S Srinivasa Rao has significantly impacted the field of engineering education in Andhra Pradesh & Telangana.

responses: Dr. S Srinivasa Rao completed his B.Tech in Electronics & Communication Engineering from Madras Institute of Technology, Chennai, one of the top engineering colleges in India. patterns: How do I apply for admission?
How can I get admitted to MRCET?
What is the process to apply to MRCET?
responses: Admissions to the Institute are made along with other engineering colleges in the state through a common entrance test conducted by the Govt. of Telangana / Andhra Pradesh.

To apply for admission, students need to take a common entrance test conducted by the Govt. of Telangana / Andhra Pradesh. The application form can be downloaded from the website and submitted in person.
The admission procedure involves a common entrance test conducted by the state government, followed by the submission of the application form, which can be downloaded from the website.

patterns: What is the eligibility criteria for B.Tech?
What are the criteria for B.Tech admission?
responses: 70% of the seats are allotted based on the merit in the Engineering and Medical Common Entrance Test (EAMCET) conducted by Govt. of Telangana / Andhra Pradesh. 30% of the seats are earmarked for Management / NRI candidates.
For B.Tech courses, 70% of seats are filled through EAMCET merit, while 30% are reserved for Management / NRI candidates.

Diploma holders can be admitted to the second year of B.Tech under the lateral entry scheme, which accounts for 20% of the intake, based on the merit in the Engineering Common Entrance Test (ECET) conducted by Govt. of Telangana / Andhra Pradesh.

patterns: What is the eligibility criteria for M.Tech?
What are the criteria for M.Tech admission?
responses:
The eligibility criteria for M.Tech courses vary by specialization:
- Aerospace Engineering: B.E / B.Tech in Aeronautical Engineering / Mechanical Engineering (or) Equivalent with valid GATE score / based on the rank obtained in the test conducted by JNTU.
- Computer Science & Engineering: B.E / B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (or) Equivalent with valid GATE score / based on the rank obtained in the test conducted by JNTU.
- Systems & Signal Processing: B.E / B.Tech in ECE / EEE / CSE / IT / EIE (or) Equivalent with valid GATE score / based on the rank obtained in the test conducted by JNTU.
- Machine Design: B.E / B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering / Automobile Engineering / Mechatronics / Aeronautical Engineering (or) Equivalent with valid GATE score / based on the rank obtained in the test conducted by JNTU.

patterns: What is the eligibility criteria for MBA?
What are the criteria for MBA admission?
responses: The minimum qualification for admission to the first year of the MBA is a pass in an undergraduate course (10 + 2 + 3). 70% of the seats are allotted based on the merit in the Integrated Common Entrance Test (ICET) conducted by Govt. of Telangana / Andhra Pradesh. 30% of the seats are earmarked for Management / NRI candidates.

patterns: How can I apply for admission?
Where can I find the application form?
responses: To apply, download the application form from the MRCET website. Fill in the form and submit it in person. 30% of seats in each branch are filled under Management Quota based on eligibility as per JNTU rules. 70% of seats are filled from Government.
You can download the application form from the website, fill it in, and submit it in person. 70% of the seats are filled by the government, while 30% are reserved for the Management Quota.

For more details, please contact:

Email ID: mrcet2004@gmail.com

You can reach out to the admission office at:

Email ID: mrcet2004@gmail.com

patterns: Boys and girls hostel at MRCET
responses: MRCET provides separate hostel buildings for boys and girls.
Healthy and hygienic dining facilities are available at the hostel.
The hostel has a purified water plant for clean drinking water.
24x7 medical facilities and ambulance services are available for emergencies.
The hostel is secured with 24x7 security and CCTV surveillance.
There is 24x7 power backup and solar hot water provision in the hostel.
Students can enjoy indoor and outdoor games in the hostel.
A TV room is available for entertainment, and the campus is Wi-Fi enabled.
The hostel maintains clean and green surroundings with regular housekeeping services.
A waiting lounge area is also provided for comfort.
Hostel fee is 90000 per annum.
MRCET provides transport facilities from various places in the city to the college.
The transport fee is 40,000 rupees per year, regardless of the route or location within the city.
The MRCET library is well-stocked with standard textbooks and books by reputable authors across all fields taught at the college.
The college follows a policy of purchasing multiple copies of books to ensure availability for a large number of students.
There is no budget approval required when purchasing books, ensuring students have access to reference materials at all times.
The library working hours are from 09:00 am to 05:30 pm, Monday to Saturday.
MRCET offers a variety of sports and fitness facilities, including a well-equipped gymnasium.
Students can enjoy playing volleyball at the sports center.
Basketball courts are available for students at MRCET.
The sports center also provides facilities for throw ball.
Football is another popular sport available at MRCET.
Kabbadi is one of the traditional sports offered at the college.
Badminton courts are provided for students at MRCET.
Cricket is a major sport at the MRCET sports center.
Facilities for athletes are available to encourage participation in track and field events.
Students can also engage in indoor games like chess.
Table tennis is another indoor sport available at MRCET.
Caroms is provided as a recreational indoor game.
The college also has facilities for handball.
Kho-kho is one of the traditional games offered at MRCET.

patterns: Students opting for higher studies at MRCET
responses: For UG (4 Years) placement statistics at MRCET, 956 students graduated and 766 students were placed.
For PG (2 Years) placement statistics at MRCET, 55 students graduated and 45 students were placed.
The average salary package for UG students is Rs. 5,10,000 per annum.
The average salary package for PG students is Rs. 5,25,000 per annum.
The median salary package for UG students is Rs. 5,10,000 per annum.
The median salary package for PG students is Rs. 5,25,000 per annum.
172 UG students opted for higher studies.
8 PG students opted for higher studies.

1. TCS
2. Capgemini
3. Deloitte
4. IBM
5. Amazon
6. Infosys
7. Mahindra
